intro: Jacquinia roigii, commonly known as the Mexican heather, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form with small, needle-like leaves. It produces clusters of white or pink flowers in late spring to early summer. Jacquinia roigii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained, acidic soils.
